abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment of
            the Mali National Rural Infrastructure Program (NRIP)
            containing a comprehensive environmental and Social
            Management Plan (ESMP) to mitigate the Program's
            potential negative impacts and to enhance its environmental
            and social benefits. There are major environmental and
            social impacts concerning irrigation development,
            particularly small-scale irrigation, rural road repair, and
            rural water supply and sanitation. To offset some of the
            expected negative impacts, regulatory actions, studies, and
            actions are recommended. These include: strengthening the
            ministry in charge of the environment, creating a
            consultative forum of all concerned parties, setting up a
            panel of experts, updating the environmental and social
            clauses in contracts so as to comply with construction
            guidelines, collaborating with local populations, providing
            STD and HIV/AIDS awareness training, providing incentives
            for gender participation, and including vulnerable groups.
            Other proposals included conducting a drainage system study,
            surveying soil salinity, addressing woodland depletion,
            elaborating a water resource study, recommending a
            groundwater management system, assessing the damage and
            control of the water hyacinth and other aquatic pests,
            managing excessive livestock numbers and their overgrazing
            as well as the rights of herders within the irrigation area,
            preparing a participatory relocation plan and analysis of
            the different social groups affected.
